channel.description: A man was imprisoned on murder charges Tuesday in the Mothering sunday stabbings of his 8-year-old girl and the little girl's best friend, who were killed as soon as they went biking in the park.Jerry Hobbs, who was recently released from the penitentiary, had led law enforcement to the bodies just off a wooded bike path early Wednesday, claiming he discovered them while searching for his or her daughter, the girl's grandfather, Arthur Hollabaugh, told The Linked Press.Hobbs, 34, was questioned through the day concerning the deaths of Laura Hobbs, 7, and Krystal Tobias, 9.The two girls had been usual and stabbed repeatedly inside the woods and left to die, Pond County Coroner Richard Keller stated. The girls were found side-by-side and also did not appear to have been in the bedroom assaulted. They seemed to have been killed Weekend evening near the location where they were identified, he said.Lake Region State's Attorney Michael Waller stated in announcing the fees Tuesday that he couldn't discuss possible causes for the killings, but prosecutors said more details tummy flatness, although out when Hobbs appears in bond the courtroom Wednesday morning.Authorities said Tuesday that additional charges might be filed, but they didn't specify what they could possibly be."This horrific crime features terrorized and traumatized the particular Zion community and I think it really is safe to say people of fine will everywhere,Inches Waller said.Outside the Tobias residence, Krystal's 15-year-old brother, Albert, said he had never met Hobbs but knew Hobbs was searching with his own family the night their sister was murdered."We never thought a father would certainly do that to a daughter," Albert Tobias explained. "They were just babies. Attorneys for the injured parties say manufacturers connected young people and controlled nicotine levels to help keep smokers addicted. However, the cigarette designers say everyone knows medical risks of smoking.A question this trial seeks to answer is whether cigarettes companies should be held liable for making hundreds of thousands of Florida people who smoke sick.Professor David LoganCBS News Correspondent Jules Chen spoke to Get up Forest University Regulation Professor David Logan , a professional in tobacco litigation.He said this demo could set the tone for other litigation down the road."For plaintiff lawyers, it is an efficient method to try the cases, and possess all the proof for the group of people handled at one time," Logan explained.
